video.mediaStreamNotActive: Media stream not yet active. Wait a second and try again.
video.recordingStoppedForStream: Recording for stream '{{streamName}}' has stopped. Stopping health monitor for this stream.
video.recordingStoppedMonitoring: Recording has stopped. Stopping health monitor for this stream.
video.cannotGetVideoFileSize: Cannot get size of the video output file. Please check if the file exists. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.cannotGetFileSize: Cannot get size of the video output file. Please check if the file exists. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.videoFileNotGrowing: The video output file is not growing. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.videoChunksNotGrowing: The number of video chunks is not growing. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.chunksNotGrowing: The number of video chunks is not growing. This can indicate a problem with the recording.
video.chunkNotSaved: Oops, looks like a video chunk could not be saved. Retrying...
video.chunkLossWarning: A part of your video recording could not be saved. This usually happens when the device's storage is full or the performance is low. We recommend stopping the recording and trying again, as the video may be incomplete or corrupted on several parts.
video.sequentialChunksLoss: Warning: Several video chunks could not be saved. The video recording may be impacted.
video.fivePercentChunksLoss: Warning: More than 5% of the video chunks could not be saved. The video recording may be impacted.
video.failedToAddChunk: Failed to add chunk {{chunksCount}} to live processor: {{error}}
video.failedToInitializeProcessor: Failed to initialize live processor for stream {{streamName}}: {{error}}
video.failedToInitializeLiveProcessor: Failed to initialize live processor for stream.
video.failedToInitiateRecording: Failed to initiate recording. First chunk was lost. Try again.
video.streamDeletedAndIgnored: Stream '{{streamName}}' has been deleted and added to the ignored list.
video.streamNotFound: Stream with external id '{{externalId}}' not found.
video.streamRestored: Stream '{{externalId}}' has been restored from the ignored list.
video.streamNotInIgnoredList: Stream with external id '{{externalId}}' is not in the ignored list.

VideoPlayer.selectNewStream: Please open this video player configuration and select a new stream from the ones available, or check your source for issues.

Plotter.maxSamplesHint: Higher values will show more history but may impact performance

Map.cannotCenterOnHome: Cannot center map on home (home position undefined).
Map.trackingHome: Tracking home position. Click to stop tracking.

doItYourself.instruction1: Use the HTML, CSS, and JS editors to create your custom widget
doItYourself.instruction2: Changes are applied when you click Apply or press Cmd/Ctrl + Enter/S
doItYourself.instruction3: Navigate between editors using Cmd/Ctrl + Option/Alt + ↑/↓
doItYourself.instruction4: Reset to last saved state using the Reset button
doItYourself.instruction5: Your code runs in the widget's context and has access to the DOM
doItYourself.instruction6: You can use the console to debug your code
doItYourself.instruction7: You can use the data-lake system to inject or consume data from Cockpit. Check the docs for more

VideoLibraryModal.rawChunksInfo: These are raw video chunks that need to be processed. The processing can be done exclusively in the standalone version of Cockpit. The browser version can only record the video chunks.
VideoLibraryModal.downloadChunksStep: Download your video chunks using the download buttons
VideoLibraryModal.openStandaloneStep: Open the standalone version of Cockpit (desktop app)
VideoLibraryModal.goToProcessingTabStep: Go to the "Processing" tab in the video library
VideoLibraryModal.selectAndProcessStep: Select and process your downloaded ZIP files
VideoLibraryModal.deleteChunksStep: Once sure the video is processed, delete the raw video chunks from here
VideoLibraryModal.zipProcessedSuccess: The ZIP file has been successfully processed. The video is now available in the Videos tab.
VideoLibraryModal.selectZipDescription: Select a ZIP file containing raw video chunks downloaded from the browser version.
VideoLibraryModal.downloadFromRawTab: Download raw video chunks from the browser version's "Raw" tab
VideoLibraryModal.selectZipFile: Select the ZIP file containing the chunks
VideoLibraryModal.clickProcessZip: Click "Process ZIP" to convert chunks to MP4 video
VideoLibraryModal.videoAppearsInTab: The processed video will appear in the "Videos" tab
VideoLibraryModal.processZipFiles: Process ZIP files with raw video chunks
VideoLibraryModal.processRawChunksFromWeb: Process raw chunks from Cockpit Lite (web version)
VideoLibraryModal.computerMultiSelect: Command+click, Ctrl+click or Long click to select multiple videos.
VideoLibraryModal.mobileMultiSelect: Long press to select multiple videos.
VideoLibraryModal.startRecording: Start recording videos to create raw chunks.
VideoLibraryModal.longPressMultiSelect: Long press to select multiple videos.

DataLakeVariableDialog.expressionInfo: Create complex transformations by combining existing Data Lake variables using JavaScript expressions.
DataLakeVariableDialog.expressionTip2: Return is optional, but should be included in complex expressions
DataLakeVariableDialog.expressionTip3: Remember to set the type accordingly
DataLakeVariableDialog.descriptionPlaceholder: Optional description of what this transformation does

About.description1: Cockpit is an intuitive and customizable cross-platform ground control station for remote vehicles of all types.
About.description2: It was created by Blue Robotics and is entirely open-source.
About.description3: It currently supports Ardupilot-based vehicles, but has plans to support any generic vehicle, be it communicating MAVLink or not.

1.title: Welcome to Cockpit!
1.content: Thank you for trying our control station software - we hope you make it your own!
1.opposite: This guide will assist you in connecting to your vehicle, and walk you through the available menu pages.

2.title: Main Menu
2.content: Cockpit's configuration options and tools are accessed through its sidebar.
2.opposite: Open it by clicking the highlighted tab on the left side of the screen.

3.title: Connections and Behaviour
3.opposite: The 'Settings' menu allows configuring Cockpit's connections and behavior.

4.title: General Configuration
4.content: The 'General' page allows switching the active user, and the vehicle connection settings.
4.opposite: Each user can have their own settings, interface profiles, and joystick mappings, which can be stored on and synchronized through the connected vehicle.

5.title: Vehicle Address
5.content: Cockpit connects to a vehicle's network using a global address.
5.opposite: This is usually found automatically, but if necessary you can specify a custom domain to connect to and search for the relevant vehicle components.

6.title: Interface Configuration
6.opposite: Here, you'll find options to control the interface style, move the sidebar access point, and switch the display units between imperial and metric, for widgets that support it.

7.title: Joystick Configuration
7.content: Connect a controller and move a joystick or press a button to see the current function mapping.
7.opposite: Fully supported joysticks have a visual configuration interface available, but there's also a mapping table provided for custom or uncommon controllers. Actions can be related to vehicle functions.

8.title: Video Configuration
8.content: Video sources (from MAVLink Camera Manager / BlueOS) can be given custom names, and you can configure Cockpit's receiver settings to improve performance.
8.opposite: There are also preferences for the video recording library, to automatically process recorded chunks into video files, and zip together files when downloading multiple videos or a video with telemetry subtitles.

9.title: Telemetry Recording
9.opposite: Subtitle overlays of telemetry data can be recorded with videos. This panel allows choosing which variables to include, where they appear on the screen, how the subtitles are styled, and the update rate.

10.title: Alerts Configuration
10.opposite: Voice alerts can announce notifications and issues during operation, without covering the screen. The voice and reported alert severities can be configured here.

11.title: Dev Settings
11.content: This section includes settings and Cockpit logs to help with development and advanced troubleshooting.
11.opposite: We recommend leaving the default values, but if you prefer to you can stop Cockpit from synchronizing its settings with BlueOS vehicles, and/or disable sending the anonymous usage statistics and error messages that help the development team to find performance issues and bugs.

12.title: Mission Configuration
12.opposite: This panel allows selecting which vehicle commands require an extra confirmation step before sending, to avoid triggering mission- or safety-critical functions accidentally.

13.title: Tutorial Completed
13.opposite: If you want to see it again, this guide can be reopened through 'Settings' > 'General'. For further support, please reach out through the channels listed in the 'About' section of the sidebar.

Tutorial.snackbarMessage: This guide can be reopened via the Settings > General menu

UpdateNotification.checkingMessage: Looking for new versions of the application...
UpdateNotification.noUpdatesMessage: You are running the latest version of the application.
UpdateNotification.updateAvailableMessage: A new version of the application is available. Would you like to download it now?
UpdateNotification.updateDownloadedMessage: The update has been downloaded. Would you like to install it now? The application will restart during installation.

VehicleDiscoveryDialog.title: Vehicle Discovery
VehicleDiscoveryDialog.notConnected: It looks like you're not connected to a vehicle!
VehicleDiscoveryDialog.description: This tool allows you to locate and connect to BlueOS vehicles within your network.
VehicleDiscoveryDialog.searching_status: Searching for vehicles in your network...
VehicleDiscoveryDialog.noVehicles: No vehicles found in your network.
VehicleDiscoveryDialog.canStillSearch: You can still search for vehicles in the general configuration menu.

UserNameInputDialog.title: Manage users on:
UserNameInputDialog.usernameInfo: This username will be used to store your settings in the vehicle.
UserNameInputDialog.autoSyncWarning: If you don't set your username, auto-sync with the vehicle won't work.
UserNameInputDialog.canSetLater: The user can be set or changed later in the General menu.
UserNameInputDialog.noUsersYet: It seems like you don't have any users stored on this device yet.
UserNameInputDialog.deleteWarning: Be careful when deleting users from the vehicle - this process cannot be undone
UserNameInputDialog.selectOrEdit: Select a user below, or switch to admin mode to create or edit users
UserNameInputDialog.deleteUserWarning: All settings will be permanently removed from the vehicle.
UserNameInputDialog.cannotDeleteCurrent: You cannot delete the current user.
UserNameInputDialog.deleteUserFailed: Failed deleting user. The list was refreshed. Please try again.
UserNameInputDialog.validationMinLength: Username must be at least 3 characters long.
UserNameInputDialog.validationMaxLength: Username must be at most 16 characters long.
UserNameInputDialog.validationCharacters: Username can only contain letters, numbers, and the following characters: _ - .
UserNameInputDialog.validationNoCockpit: Username cannot contain "cockpit" as it is reserved for internal use.
UserNameInputDialog.validationNoFallback: Username cannot contain "fallback" as it is reserved for internal use.

ArchitectureWarning.title: Performance Warning
ArchitectureWarning.runningWrongVersion: You are running the x64 version of Cockpit on an Apple Silicon Mac (M series), which causes severely degraded performance, including:
ArchitectureWarning.cannotDisable: This warning cannot be disabled - we strongly recommend that you download and install the intended version for your system.

ArmSafetyDialog.title: Be careful
ArmSafetyDialog.vehicleArmedWarning: The vehicle is currently armed, and the main-menu contains configurations and tools that can cause unsafe situations.
ArmSafetyDialog.proceedCarefully: Come back later, or proceed carefully with one of the following options:
ArmSafetyDialog.continueSessionWarn: Continue and don't warn again during this session
ArmSafetyDialog.warningDisabled: Armed menu warning disabled. You can re-enable it in the Settings > Alerts menu.

GlobalOriginDialog.title: Set Global Origin
GlobalOriginDialog.description: This feature allows you to set the GNSS coordinates of the vehicle's local origin (0,0,0). This is useful when using local position units (such as indoor positioning systems or DVLs) where you want to define a corresponding global position.

MissionChecklist.title: Mission Checklist
MissionChecklist.description: Before arming the vehicle, make sure the following items are completed:
MissionChecklist.typeAndEnter: Type an item and press Enter
MissionChecklist.typeItemAndEnter: Type an item and press Enter
MissionChecklist.armWarningTitle: Warning! Your vehicle is about to be armed

EditMenu.toMainView: To be placed on the main view area
EditMenu.toTopBottomBars: To be placed on the top and bottom bars
EditMenu.confirmResetProfiles: Are you sure you want to reset your profiles to the default ones?

ConfigurationGeneralView.title: General configuration
ConfigurationGeneralView.userSettingsInfo: User related configuration. Here you can set the user that is currently set for this device as well as create a new user account.
ConfigurationGeneralView.pirateModeInfo: Pirate mode allows Cockpit to expose advanced features, like setting the frequency of MAVLink messages. Take care when enabling this mode.
ConfigurationGeneralView.connectionInfo: Sets the network address for device communication. E.g: blueos.local
ConfigurationGeneralView.vehicleNetworkInfo: Sets the network address for device communication. E.g: blueos.local
ConfigurationGeneralView.vehicleAddressHint: Address of the Vehicle. E.g: blueos.local
ConfigurationGeneralView.webrtcUriHint: URI of a WebRTC Signalling Server URI
ConfigurationGeneralView.genericWebSocketInfo: Connect to external WebSocket servers to receive data and inject it into the data-lake.
ConfigurationGeneralView.genericWebSocketFormat: Messages should be in the format
ConfigurationGeneralView.genericWebSocketExample: You can use data-lake variables to compose the URL, for example:

video.streamNotAvailableMessage: The stream is not available anymore.
video.keepIgnoredDesc: Maintain it in the ignored list so it won't be mapped automatically if it becomes available again.
video.deletePermanentlyDesc: Remove it completely from the ignored list. If it becomes available in the future, it will be automatically mapped.

ConfigurationJoystickView.title: Joystick configuration
ConfigurationJoystickView.connectJoystick: Connect a joystick and press any key.
ConfigurationJoystickView.generalSettingsInfo: View and configure your controller button and joystick behaviors, in a diagram and/or table display.
ConfigurationJoystickView.vehicleTypesDefaultProfile: Vehicle types that use this profile by default:
ConfigurationJoystickView.holdLastInput: Hold last joystick input when window is hidden (tab changed or window minimized)
ConfigurationJoystickView.name: Name
ConfigurationJoystickView.pressKeyOrMove: Press a key or move an axis
ConfigurationJoystickView.calibrateJoystick: Calibrate your joystick to ensure accurate axis inputs.
ConfigurationJoystickView.clickToCalibrate: Click the button to open the calibration dialog, then follow the instructions to calibrate your joystick axes.
ConfigurationJoystickView.deadbandDescription1: This allows ignoring small unwanted movements near the center of each joystick.
ConfigurationJoystickView.deadbandDescription2: The deadband regions are the red regions in the center of each graph, specifying how much of the joystick axis range to ignore. Within each deadband the output is clamped to 0, and the output curve (linear or exponential) starts at the edges of the region. This is useful if a spring-loaded joystick does not get consistently returned to the exact center of each axis.
ConfigurationJoystickView.deadbandDescription3: To calibrate the deadband, click and drag the deadband regions on the graphs, set the region width numbers directly with the text-input, or click the 'auto calibrate deadband' button at the bottom. If auto-calibrating, gently touch the sticks during the calibration, while trying not to actually move them.
ConfigurationJoystickView.exponentialDescription1: This adjusts the sensitivity curve of your joysticks.
ConfigurationJoystickView.exponentialDescription2: Exponential scaling allows reducing the sensitivity of an axis near the center, for more precise control, which then steepens the curve near the edges to use the full range. A value of 1 will result in a linear curve, while greater values result in more rounded exponentials.

warning.extendedMavlinkInfo: It seems like you're running versions of Mavlink2Rest (BlueOS) and/or ArduPilot that do not support the extended MAVLink MANUAL_CONTROL message. We strongly suggest upgrading both so you can have support for additional buttons and axes on the joystick. This is especially important if you sometimes use other control station software, like QGroundControl, as Cockpit can preferentially use the extended buttons to reduce configuration clashes. We recommend using BlueOS ≥ 1.2.0, and ≥ version 4.1.2 for ArduPilot-based autopilot firmware.
warning.couldNotEstablishComm: Could not stablish communication with the vehicle.
warning.buttonFunctionsAsNumbers: Button functions will appear as numbers. If connection is restablished, function names will appear.

ConfigurationJoystickView.profileMatchesVehicle: This profile is configured for the current vehicle type
ConfigurationJoystickView.profileDoesNotMatch: This profile is not configured for the current vehicle type. Continuing may result in unexpected behavior.

ConfigurationVideoView.title: Video configuration
ConfigurationVideoView.streamsMappingInfo: Here you can map your external video streams to internal names and manage ignored streams. Active streams allow you to easily switch between different video sources in Cockpit.
ConfigurationVideoView.allowedWebRTCIPsInfo: Select the IP addresses to allow connecting to for WebRTC video streaming. For best performance it is recommended to only use the most reliable interfaces - e.g. avoid wireless interfaces if there is a tethered/wired interface available. If no value is specified, all available routes are allowed.
ConfigurationVideoView.enableAutoIpRetrieval: Enable auto-retrieval of allowed IP addresses
ConfigurationVideoView.allowedWebRTCProtocolsInfo: Video stream quality may be enhanced by enforcing a protocol that is well-suited to the available network infrastructure. UDP can be lower latency but may drop frames, while TCP enforces frame ordering at the cost of some increased latency and jitter.
ConfigurationVideoView.rtpJitterBufferInfo: Increasing the buffer duration causes additional video latency, but can help to compensate for network jitter and provide more consistent frame timing in the display. Cockpit's default is zero milliseconds, but you can set a custom value, or leave the field empty to use your browser's default.
ConfigurationVideoView.videoLibraryOptionsInfo1: Configure live video processing to process videos in real-time during recording for instant availability when recording stops. This is only available in the Electron (desktop) version.
ConfigurationVideoView.videoLibraryOptionsInfo2: Choose whether to save backup raw chunks alongside the final video file. This provides safety for video reconstruction if something goes wrong, but uses approximately double the storage space.
ConfigurationVideoView.videoLibraryOptionsInfo3: Select whether video and subtitle files should be bundled together in a ZIP archive, or downloaded individually. Zipping allows a single download of a group of files, but requires waiting for the files to get zipped together. Depending on file sizes, the zipping process may complete within seconds or could take minutes.
ConfigurationVideoView.browserVersionInfo: Video processing is not available in the browser version. Your recordings will be saved as raw chunks that can be downloaded and processed using the standalone version of Cockpit.
ConfigurationVideoView.liveVideoProcessingTooltip: Process videos in real-time during recording for instant availability when recording stops
ConfigurationVideoView.liveVideoProcessingTooltipBrowser: Live video processing is only available in the standalone version
ConfigurationVideoView.saveBackupRawChunksTooltip: Save the raw video chunks alongside the final video file for backup purposes.
ConfigurationVideoView.saveBackupRawChunksEnabled: Enabled: Raw chunks are preserved after recording. Videos use ~2x storage space but provide safety for reconstruction if the final video is corrupted.
ConfigurationVideoView.saveBackupRawChunksDisabled: Disabled: Raw chunks are automatically deleted after successful processing, using minimal storage space.
ConfigurationVideoView.saveBackupRawChunksManual: You can always manually clean up backup chunks later using the "Temporary" tab in the Video Library.
ConfigurationVideoView.saveBackupRawChunksBrowser: For the browser version the chunks are always saved by default.

ConfigurationMissionView.title: Mission configuration
ConfigurationMissionView.autoSwitchToFlightMode: Auto switch to flight mode on mission upload
ConfigurationMissionView.enableConfirmationCategoriesInfo: Add an extra confirmation step for UI elements that can trigger mission critical actions.
ConfigurationMissionView.mapOptionsInfo: Default map position: Defines the initial center and zoom level for the map. Max. vehicle position update rate: Limits how often the vehicle's position is updated on the map to reduce CPU usage.

ConfigurationAlertsView.title: Alerts configuration
ConfigurationAlertsView.voiceAlertsInfo: Enable voice alerts to receive audible notifications about system and vehicle activities. Select specific alert levels to customize which types of notifications you receive.
ConfigurationAlertsView.showArmedMenuWarning: Show warning when opening menu with armed vehicle

ConfigurationMAVLinkView.title: MAVLink configuration
ConfigurationMAVLinkView.variablesFromOtherSystemsInfo: Enable the creation of DataLake variables from MAVLink messages originating from systems/components other than the main vehicle (System ID {systemId}, Component ID 1). When enabled, variables from all MAVLink systems on the network will be available in the DataLake.
ConfigurationMAVLinkView.legacyVariableNamesInfo: Create duplicate variables with the old naming format for backwards compatibility. Enabled by default - users with older setups may want to disable this for performance. If disabled, you will need to manually replace usages of the legacy variables with the new ones in mini-widgets (e.g.: VGI, Plotter) and scripts (e.g.: DataLake transformation functions).
ConfigurationMAVLinkView.enableVariablesFromOtherSystems: Enable DataLake variables from other systems
ConfigurationMAVLinkView.messageIntervalsInfo: Configure the frequency at which each MAVLink message is requested from the vehicle. Higher frequencies provide more responsive data but increase the load on the network and in the vehicle's CPU. If the message is not already configured, you can add it to the interval configuration with the forms in the bottom.
ConfigurationMAVLinkView.setIntervalForNewMessage: Set the interval for a new message

ConfigurationActionsView.title: Cockpit actions configuration
ConfigurationActionsView.info1: View, manage, and create different types of actions.
ConfigurationActionsView.info2: HTTP Request actions can be used to call external APIs, like servers, vehicles, cameras, etc.
ConfigurationActionsView.info3: MAVLink Message actions allow you to send specific MAVLink messages to vehicles.
ConfigurationActionsView.info4: JavaScript actions give you full flexibility by allowing you to write custom code.
ConfigurationActionsView.info5: The link button can be used to link Actions to Data Lake variables, so that changes to the variable value will automatically trigger the linked action.
ConfigurationActionsView.info6: Actions can also be tested/run manually, using the play button.
ConfigurationActionsView.name: Name
ConfigurationActionsView.httpRequestDescription: Create an action to make HTTP requests to external APIs and services
ConfigurationActionsView.mavlinkMessageDescription: Create an action to send MAVLink messages to vehicles
ConfigurationActionsView.javascriptDescription: Create a custom action using JavaScript code

mavlinkAction.messageFieldsHint: Insert a JSON object with the message fields here. Use {{ data_lake_key }} for dynamic values. Use { type: 'ENUM_VALUE' } for enum values (e.g.: MAV_CMD_COMPONENT_ARM_DISARM).

JavascriptActionConfig.autocompleteHint: Type {{ to autocomplete data lake variables

MissionPlanningView.homeWaypointDescription: Please set the home waypoint position using the context menu on the map. The home waypoint position is used to determine the position where the vehicle will return to when the mission is completed or when the vehicle is in a fail-safe state.

messages: Distributing dolphins for sonar translations...
Observing octopuses to optimize dark mode...
Persuading Poseidon to trade us his trident...
Sailing the seas, in sync with the breeze...
Jiggling jellyfish to frost up the UI...
Corralling coral for calibration...
Languishing in life-jackets...
Salvaging shipwrecks...
Searching for Nemo...
Singing with whales...
Tuning harps for carp...
Stargazing with starfish...
Recharging electric eels...
Swaying at the seaweed disco...
Fencing in the swordfish showdown...
Assembling AUVs into a single-file line...
Polishing portholes for crystal-clear viewports...
Convincing crabs to stop double-clicking everything...
Syncing compass with the stars (hold still, Orion)...
Kowtowing to kelp for a greener UI theme...
Warming up thrusters — and the coffee machine...
Updating barnacle firmware — this might tickle...
Deploying rubber ducks for safety certification...
Filling ballast tanks with fresh ideas...
Mapping ocean puns… depth-level humor detected...
Rendering waves pixel by pixel — surf's almost up...
Teaching seagulls the latest hover gestures...
Checking tide tables to schedule snack breaks...
Swapping batteries in the sea turtles (just kidding)...
Dusting off code gremlins  —  please keep arms inside the Cockpit...
Aligning gyros — because spin is only fun on dance floors...

alerts.errorGettingExternalWidgetsInfo: Error getting info around external widgets from BlueOS.

poi.name: Name
poi.noPoiSelected: No Point of Interest selected for deletion.

missionEstimates.title: Mission estimates
missionEstimates.extraPayloadDesc: Mass added to the vehicle besides batteries and hull.
missionEstimates.batteryTypeDesc: Li-ion (≈5 g/Wh), Li-Po (≈6 g/Wh), LiFePO₄ (≈9 g/Wh).
missionEstimates.batteryCapacityDesc: Total capacity from the vehicle batteries. Affects mass and power estimate.
missionEstimates.hasHighDragSensor: Vehicle has a submerged probe (e.g. Ping1D sonar)
missionEstimates.hasHighDragSensorDesc: Submerged probes affect drag and consequently, the power consumption estimates.

about.description1: Cockpit is an intuitive and customizable cross-platform ground control station for remote vehicles of all types.
about.description2: It was created by Blue Robotics and it's fully open source.
about.description3: It currently supports Ardupilot-based vehicles but plans to support any general vehicle, whether MAVLink-communicating or not.

actions.useDynamicValuesHint: Use dynamic values from the data lake by wrapping variable names in double curly braces
actions.userAgentNote: Note: User-Agent header is automatically set

architectureWarning.cannotDisable: This warning cannot be disabled - we strongly recommend that you download and install the intended version for your system.
architectureWarning.runningWrongVersion: You are running the x64 version of Cockpit on an Apple Silicon Mac (M series), which causes severely degraded performance, including:
architectureWarning.title: Performance Warning

armSafety.continueSessionWarn: Continue and don't warn again during this session
armSafety.proceedCarefully: Come back later, or proceed carefully with one of the following options:
armSafety.title: Vehicle Armed Warning
armSafety.vehicleArmedWarning: The vehicle is currently armed, and the main-menu contains configurations and tools that can cause unsafe situations.

batteryIndicator.voltageConfigTooltip: Configure these voltage levels according to your battery pack. Defaults are based on Blue Robotics' 4S Li-ion battery pack.

javascriptAction.autocompleteHint: Type {{ to autocomplete data lake variables

joystickWarning.buttonFunctionsAsNumbers: Button functions will appear as numbers. If connection is restablished, function names will appear.
joystickWarning.couldNotEstablishComm: Could not establish communication with the vehicle.
joystickWarning.extendedMavlinkInfo: It seems like you're running versions of Mavlink2Rest (BlueOS) and/or ArduPilot that do not support the extended MAVLink MANUAL_CONTROL message. We strongly suggest upgrading both so you can have support for additional buttons and axes on the joystick. This is especially important if you sometimes use other control station software, like QGroundControl, as Cockpit can preferentially use the extended buttons to reduce configuration clashes. We recommend using BlueOS ≥ 1.2.0, and ≥ version 4.1.2 for ArduPilot-based autopilot firmware.

ekfStateIndicator.noData: No EKF data - Check vehicle connection
No EKF data - Check vehicle connection

doItYourself.instruction1: Use the HTML, CSS and JS editors to create your custom widget
doItYourself.instruction2: Changes will be applied when you click Apply or press Cmd/Ctrl + Enter/S
doItYourself.instruction3: Use Cmd/Ctrl + Option/Alt + ↑/↓ to navigate between editors
doItYourself.instruction4: Use the reset button to reset to the last saved state
doItYourself.instruction5: Your code runs in the context of the widget and has access to the DOM
doItYourself.instruction6: You can use the console to debug your code
doItYourself.instruction7: You can use the data lake system to inject or consume data from Cockpit. Check the documentation for more information

plotter.decimalPlacesHint: Number of decimal places to be displayed
plotter.maxSamplesHint: Higher values will show more history but may impact performance
plotter.pleaseSelectVariable: Please open the Plotter widget configuration menu to select a variable to be plotted.
plotter.selectVariable: Select a variable to be plotted
plotter.updateOnConstantValueHint: Advance graph when value is unchanged (shows horizontal lines for constant values)

1.content: Thank you for trying our control station software - we hope you make it your own!
1.opposite: This guide will assist you in connecting to your vehicle, and walk you through the available menu pages.
1.title: Welcome to Cockpit!

2.content: Cockpit's configuration options and tools are accessed through its sidebar.
2.opposite: Open it by clicking the highlighted tab on the left side of the screen.
2.title: Main Menu

3.opposite: The 'Settings' menu allows configuring Cockpit's connections and behavior.
3.title: Connections and Behaviour

4.content: The 'General' page allows switching the active user, and the vehicle connection settings.
4.opposite: Each user can have their own settings, interface profiles, and joystick mappings, which can be stored on and synchronized through the connected vehicle.
4.title: General Configuration

5.content: Cockpit connects to a vehicle's network using a global address.
5.opposite: This is usually found automatically, but if necessary you can specify a custom domain to connect to and search for the relevant vehicle components.
5.title: Vehicle Address

6.opposite: Here, you'll find options to control the interface style, move the sidebar access point, and switch the display units between imperial and metric, for widgets that support it.
6.title: Interface Configuration

7.content: Connect a controller and move a joystick or press a button to see the current function mapping.
7.opposite: Fully supported joysticks have a visual configuration interface available, but there's also a mapping table provided for custom or uncommon controllers. Actions can be related to vehicle functions.
7.title: Joystick Configuration

8.content: Video sources (from MAVLink Camera Manager / BlueOS) can be given custom names, and you can configure Cockpit's receiver settings to improve performance.
8.opposite: There are also preferences for the video recording library, to automatically process recorded chunks into video files, and zip together files when downloading multiple videos or a video with telemetry subtitles.
8.title: Video Configuration

9.opposite: Subtitle overlays of telemetry data can be recorded with videos. This panel allows choosing which variables to include, where they appear on the screen, how the subtitles are styled, and the update rate.
9.title: Telemetry Recording

10.opposite: Voice alerts can announce notifications and issues during operation, without covering the screen. The voice and reported alert severities can be configured here.
10.title: Alerts Configuration

11.content: This section includes settings and Cockpit logs to help with development and advanced troubleshooting.
11.opposite: We recommend leaving the default values, but if you prefer to you can stop Cockpit from synchronizing its settings with BlueOS vehicles, and/or disable sending the anonymous usage statistics and error messages that help the development team to find performance issues and bugs.
11.title: Dev Settings

12.opposite: This panel allows selecting which vehicle commands require an extra confirmation step before sending, to avoid triggering mission- or safety-critical functions accidentally.
12.title: Mission Configuration

13.opposite: If you want to see it again, this guide can be reopened through 'Settings' > 'General'. For further support, please reach out through the channels listed in the 'About' section of the sidebar.
13.title: Tutorial Completed

veryGenericIndicator.useStringVariable: Use string variable (don't parse as number)

widgetsView.openEditMode: Open edit mode to start tweaking this view.

editPanel.confirmResetProfiles: Are you sure you want to reset all profiles? This action cannot be undone.

globalOrigin.description: Configure the global origin for your mission
globalOrigin.title: Global Origin

iframe.useVehicleAddress: Use vehicle address as base URL

logs.videoConfigHelp: Access video configuration to configure recording and streaming options.

videoConfigHelpDetails.telemetryConfig: On this screen, you can configure the telemetry data that will be displayed on the subtitle file for recorded videos. You can change the font size, color, and style, as well as the position of each variable on the screen. You can also add custom messages that will be displayed on the video player screen.
videoConfigHelpDetails.dragAndDrop: Drag and drop variables from the left panel to the desired position on the Telemetry Data Display.
videoConfigHelpDetails.moreHelp: For additional Help, refer to documentation or contact us.

update.noUpdatesMessage: You are using the latest version.
update.updateAvailableMessage: A new version is available. Would you like to download it now?
update.updateDownloadedMessage: Update has been downloaded and is ready to install.

usernameDialog.autoSyncWarning: If you don't set a username, auto-sync with the vehicle won't work.
usernameDialog.canSetLater: Can be set or changed later in the general menu.
usernameDialog.deleteWarning: Be careful when deleting users from the vehicle - this process cannot be undone
usernameDialog.noUsersYet: You don't have any users stored on this vehicle yet.
usernameDialog.selectOrEdit: Select a user below, or switch to admin mode to create or edit users
usernameDialog.title: Username
usernameDialog.usernameInfo: This username will be used to store your settings on the vehicle.
usernameDialog.validationCharacters: Only letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores

vehicleDiscovery.noVehicles: No vehicles found on your network.
vehicleDiscovery.notConnected: Looks like you're not connected to a vehicle yet!

vehicleDiscovery.title: Vehicle Discovery
